identificationModule.briefTitle: The Heidelberg Engineering ANTERION Software Comparison Precision and Agreement Study
identificationModule.officialTitle: The Heidelberg Engineering ANTERION Software Comparison Precision and Agreement Study

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study is conducted to compare the the investigational device ANTERION with software version 1.5 against the ANTERION with software version 1.2.4 (cleared version)

interventions.name: ANTERION investigational
interventions.description: Measurements from the investigational device ANTERION with software version 1.5 are to be compared against measurements from the ANTERION with software version 1.2.4 (cleared version)

primaryOutcomes.description: Reproducibility and repeatability of Central Cornea Thickness of ANTERION and the reference device
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 1 day

primaryOutcomes.description: Reproducibility and repeatability of Thinnest Point Thickness of ANTERION and the reference device
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 1 day

primaryOutcomes.description: Reproducibility and repeatability of Lens Thickness of ANTERION and the reference device
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 1 day

primaryOutcomes.description: Reproducibility and repeatability of Anterior Chamber Depth of ANTERION and the reference device
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 1 day

primaryOutcomes.description: Reproducibility and repeatability of Axial Length of ANTERION and the reference device
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 1 day

secondaryOutcomes.description: Adverse events found during the clinical study
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 1 day

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria Normal Anterior Segment

1. Age 22 years or older
2. Able and willing to undergo the test procedures, sign informed consent, and follow instructions
3. Able to fixate
4. Eye(s) with normal anterior segment

Exclusion Criteria Normal Anterior Segment

1. Active infection or inflammation in the study eye
2. Insufficient tear film or corneal reflex
3. Physical inability to be properly positioned at the study devices or eye exam equipment
4. Rigid contact lens wear 2 weeks prior to imaging
5. Soft lenses worn within one hour prior to imaging
6. Cataract grade ≥1.5

Inclusion Criteria Abnormal Anterior Segment

1. Age 22 years or older
2. Able and willing to undergo the test procedures, sign informed consent, and follow instructions
3. Able to fixate
4. Eye(s) with abnormal anterior segment (including cataract grade ≥ 1.5)

Exclusion Criteria Abnormal Anterior Segment

1. Active infection or inflammation in the study eye
2. Insufficient tear film or corneal reflex
3. Physical inability to be properly positioned at the study devices or eye exam equipment
4. Rigid contact lens wear 2 weeks prior to imaging
5. Soft lenses worn within one hour prior to imaging
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Eyes with normal and eyes with abnormal anterior segment population
